verses.verse: When the people<WH5971> saw<WH7200> that Moses<WH4872> delayed<WH954> to come down<WH3381> from the mountain,<WH2022> the people<WH5971> gathered themselves together<WH6950> to Aaron,<WH175> and said<WH559> to him,<WH6965> "Come, make<WH6213> us gods,<WH430> which shall go<WH3212> before<WH6440> us;<WH4872> for as for this Moses, the man<WH376> who brought<WH5927> us up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> we don't<WH3045> know what has become of him."

Aaron<WH175> said<WH559> to them,<WH6561> "Take off the golden<WH2091> rings,<WH5141> which are in the ears<WH241> of your wives,<WH802> of your sons,<WH1121> and of your daughters,<WH1323> and bring them to me.<WH935>"
All the people<WH5971> took off<WH6561> the golden<WH2091> rings<WH5141> which were in their ears,<WH241> and brought<WH935> them to Aaron.<WH175>

He received<WH3947> what they handed<WH3027> him,<WH6696> and fashioned it with an engraving tool,<WH2747> and made<WH6213> it a molten<WH4541> calf;<WH5695> and they said,<WH559> "These are your gods,<WH430> Israel,<WH3478> which brought<WH5927> you up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>"

When Aaron<WH175> saw<WH7200> this,<WH1129> he built an altar<WH4196> before<WH6440> it;<WH175> and Aaron made a proclamation,<WH7121> and said,<WH559> "Tomorrow<WH4279> shall be a feast<WH2282> to Yahweh.<WH3068>"

They rose up early<WH7925> on the next day,<WH4283> and offered<WH5927> burnt offerings,<WH5930> and brought<WH5066> peace offerings;<WH8002> and the people<WH5971> sat<WH3427> down to eat<WH398> and to drink,<WH8354> and rose up<WH6965> to play.<WH6711>

Yahweh<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses,<WH4872> "Go,<WH3212> get down;<WH3381> for your people,<WH5971> who you brought<WH5927> up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> have corrupted themselves!<WH7843>

They have turned<WH5493> aside quickly<WH4118> out of the way<WH1870> which I commanded<WH6680> them.<WH6213> They have made themselves a molten<WH4541> calf,<WH5695> and have worshiped<WH7812> it,<WH2076> and have sacrificed to it,<WH559> and said, <WH430> 'These are your gods, Israel,<WH3478> which brought you up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>'"
Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "I have seen<WH7200> these people,<WH5971> and behold,<WH7186> they are a stiff-necked people.<WH5971>
Now therefore leave me alone,<WH3240> that my wrath<WH639> may burn hot<WH2734> against them,<WH3615> and that I may consume them;<WH6213> and I will make of you a great<WH1419> nation.<WH1471>"

Moses<WH4872> begged<WH2470> Yahweh<WH3068> his God,<WH430> and said,<WH559> "Yahweh,<WH3068> why does your wrath<WH639> burn hot<WH2734> against your people,<WH5971> that you have brought out<WH3318> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> with great<WH1419> power<WH3581> and with a mighty<WH2389> hand?<WH3027>

Why should the Egyptians<WH4714> speak,<WH559> saying,<WH559> <WH3318> 'He brought them forth for evil,<WH7451> to kill<WH2026> them in the mountains,<WH2022> and to consume<WH3615> them from the surface<WH6440> of the earth?<WH127>' Turn<WH7725> from your fierce<WH2740> wrath,<WH639> and repent<WH5162> of this evil<WH7451> against your people.<WH5971>

Remember<WH2142> Abraham,<WH85> Isaac,<WH3327> and Israel,<WH3478> your servants,<WH5650> to whom you swore<WH7650> by your own self,<WH1696> and said to them,<WH7235> 'I will multiply your seed<WH2233> as the stars<WH3556> of the sky,<WH8064> and all this land<WH776> that I have spoken<WH559> of I will give<WH5414> to your seed,<WH2233> and they shall inherit<WH5157> it forever.<WH5769>'"
Yahweh<WH3068> repented<WH5162> of the evil<WH7451> which he said<WH1696> he would do<WH6213> to his people.<WH5971>

Moses<WH4872> turned,<WH6437> and went down<WH3381> from the mountain,<WH2022> with the two<WH8147> tablets<WH3871> of the testimony<WH5715> in his hand;<WH3027> tablets<WH3871> that were written<WH3789> on both<WH8147> their sides;<WH5676> on the one side and on the other they were written.<WH3789>
The tablets<WH3871> were the work<WH4639> of God,<WH430> and the writing<WH4385> was the writing<WH4385> of God,<WH430> engraved<WH2801> on the tables.<WH3871>
When Joshua<WH3091> heard<WH8085> the noise<WH6963> of the people<WH5971> as they shouted,<WH7452> he said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "There is the noise<WH6963> of war<WH4421> in the camp.<WH4264>"

He said,<WH559> "It isn't<WH6963> the voice of those who shout<WH6030> for victory,<WH1369> neither is it the voice<WH6963> of those who cry<WH6030> for being overcome;<WH2476> but the noise<WH6963> of those who sing<WH6031> that I hear.<WH8085>"

It happened,<WH7126> as soon as he came near to the camp,<WH4264> that he saw<WH7200> the calf<WH5695> and the dancing:<WH4246> and Moses<WH4872>' anger<WH639> grew hot,<WH2734> and he threw<WH7993> the tablets<WH3871> out of his hands,<WH3027> and broke<WH7665> them beneath<WH8478> the mountain.<WH2022>

He took<WH3947> the calf<WH5695> which they had made,<WH6213> and burnt<WH8313> it with fire,<WH784> ground<WH2912> it to powder,<WH1854> and scattered<WH2219> it on<WH6440> the water,<WH4325> and made the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> drink of it.<WH8248>
Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> to Aaron,<WH175> "What did<WH6213> these people<WH5971> do to you,<WH935> that you have brought a great<WH1419> sin on them?<WH2401>"
Aaron<WH175> said,<WH559> "Don't<WH639> let the anger of my lord<WH113> grow hot.<WH2734> You know<WH3045> the people,<WH5971> that they are set on evil.<WH7451>

For they said<WH559> to me,<WH6213> 'Make us gods,<WH430> which shall go<WH3212> before<WH6440> us;<WH4872> for as for this Moses, the man<WH376> who brought us up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> we don't<WH3045> know what has become of him.'

I said<WH559> to them,<WH2091> 'Whoever has any gold, let them take<WH6561> it off:<WH5414>' so they gave it to me;<WH7993> and I threw it into the fire,<WH784> and out<WH3318> came this calf.<WH5695>"
When Moses<WH4872> saw<WH7200> that the people<WH5971> had broken loose,<WH6544> (for Aaron<WH175> had let them loose<WH6544> for a derision<WH8103> among their enemies<WH6965>),

then Moses<WH4872> stood<WH5975> in the gate<WH8179> of the camp,<WH4264> and said,<WH559> "Whoever is on Yahweh<WH3068>'s side,<WH1121> come to me!" All the sons of Levi<WH3878> gathered themselves together to him.<WH622>

He said<WH559> to them,<WH559> "Thus says Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> <WH376> 'Every man put<WH7760> his sword<WH2719> on his thigh,<WH3409> and go<WH5674> back and forth<WH7725> from gate<WH8179> to gate<WH8179> throughout the camp,<WH4264> and every man<WH376> kill<WH2026> his brother,<WH251> and every man<WH376> his companion,<WH7453> and every man<WH376> his neighbor.<WH7138>'"

The sons<WH1121> of Levi<WH3878> did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> of Moses:<WH4872> and there fell<WH5307> of the people<WH5971> that day<WH3117> about three<WH7969> thousand<WH505> men.<WH376>

Moses<WH4872> said,<WH559> "Consecrate yourselves<WH4390> today<WH3117> to Yahweh,<WH3068> yes,<WH3588> every man<WH376> against his son,<WH1121> and against his brother;<WH251> that he may bestow<WH5414> on you a blessing<WH1293> this day.<WH3117>"

It happened on the next day,<WH4283> that Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> to the people,<WH5971> "You have sinned<WH2398> a great<WH1419> sin.<WH2401> Now I will go up<WH5927> to Yahweh.<WH3068> Perhaps<WH194> I shall make atonement<WH3722> for<WH1157> your sin.<WH2403>"

Moses<WH4872> returned<WH7725> to Yahweh,<WH3068> and said,<WH559> "Oh,<WH577> this people<WH5971> have sinned<WH2398> a great<WH1419> sin,<WH2401> and have made<WH6213> themselves gods<WH430> of gold.<WH2091>
Yet now,<WH5375> if you will, forgive their sin<WH2403>â€”and if not,<WH4229> please blot me out of your book<WH5612> which you have written.<WH3789>"
Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "Whoever<WH834> has sinned<WH2398> against me,<WH4229> him will I blot out of my book.<WH5612>

Now go,<WH3212> lead<WH5148> the people<WH5971> to the place of which I have spoken<WH1696> to you.<WH4397> Behold, my angel shall go<WH3212> before<WH6440> you.<WH3117> Nevertheless in the day when I punish,<WH6485> I will punish<WH6485> them for their sin.<WH2403>"
